section.title: employees creating new New Employee
section.para: Employees are people who work for your company. An Employee may or may not be an xTuple ERP system user. To create a new Employee, use the following screen:
When creating a new Employee, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Employee's name. If the Employee is also an xTuple ERP system user, then you should enter the Employee's system username here.
Enter a number to uniquely identify the Employee.
Select if the Employee is currently active. Not selecting makes the Employee inactive.
Manually enter Employee Contact information in the fields below—or use the browse buttons to select pre-existing Contact and Address information.

note.para: If new Contact or Address information is manually entered here, that information will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts and/or Addresses.

section.para: To associate an Image with an Employee, select the "Image" tab. The following screen will appear:
When associating an Image with an Employee, you will be presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select an Image from the list of available Images to associate with the Employee. You can learn more about adding Images to the database here .

section.para: To specify administrative details related to an Employee, select the "Detail" tab. The following screen will appear:
When specifying administrative details related to an Employee, you will be presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the Site (i.e., Site, Store Location, etc.) where the Employee is principally located.
Enter the name of the Employee's manager.
Specify the Employee's Department.
Specify the Shift the Employee generally works.
Specify whether the Employee is paid hourly or on a salary basis.
Specify the Employee's compensation rate.
Specify the period of time corresponding to the Employee's pay rate. The following options are available: Hour, Day, Week, Bi-Weekly, Year

If you have the ability to create new xTuple ERP system users, then select this option to create the Employee as a system user. If the Employee is already a system user, then this option will already be checked.

tip.para: To ensure correspondence between the Employee record and the system user record, the Employee name should match the Employee's system username.

listitem.para: Select if the Employee is a Sales Representative. If the Employee is already listed as a Sales Rep., then this option will already by checked.

section.para: To add Notes to an Employee, select the "Notes" tab. The following screen will appear:
When adding Notes to an Employee, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Notes related to the Employee. Any Notes entered on this screen are for internal purposes only.

section.para: To add Comments to an Employee, select the "Comments" tab at the bottom of the "Employee" screen. The following screen will appear:

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

section.para: To create a new Employee Characteristic, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
When creating a new Employee Characteristic, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select a Characteristic from the list of Characteristics designated as being available for use as Employee Characteristics.
Enter a value to associate with the Employee Characteristic.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating the Employee Characteristic, returning you to the previous screen.
Creates the Employee Characteristic and adds it to the list of Employee Characteristics.

section.para: To associate group memberships with an Employee, select the "Group Membership" tab. The following screen will appear:
When associating group memberships with an Employee, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enables you to edit highlighted Employee Groups. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Employee Group—except that when editing, the fields will contain Employee Group information. Double-clicking on an Employee Group will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight an Employee Group and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight an Employee Group and then select this button to remove the association between the Employee Group and the Employee.
